channel.title: Stories from jalopnik.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best jalopnik.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: The First Airplane To Fly In England Was Absolutely Ridiculous Looking
item.description: Where America had the Wright Brothers and their powered flight in 1903, our British pals celebrate Horatio Phillips and his imaginatively-named Flying Machine of 1907.

item.title: Inside The Ship That Stands Watch Over The Melting Arctic
item.description: You can tell the Norwegian research vessel Johan Hjort is made for the Arctic because it holds a tanning bed inside.

item.title: I Asked A Real Car Color Professional Hard-Hitting Questions About Car Color And Here's The Result
item.description: Despite frivolous distractions like this whole "pandemic" and "global economic shutdown" we all know that the real crisis is the Crisis of Boring Car Colors.

item.title: How I Turned A Free Jeep Grand Wagoneer Into A Decent Example Of A True Classic
item.description: When I took ownership of my free Jeep Grand Wagoneer last summer, I had low expectations. The Jeep hadn't run in many years, it was filled with mouse crap and it was fairly rusty. But after some wrenching and cleaning, I've now got a decent example of one of the most value-appreciating Jeeps in all of the land. Check it out.

item.title: This Is How Sudanese Militants Get Their Hands On So Many Toyota Pickups
item.description: But how did Global Witness track these Toyotas down? How do they know that they're the same allotment of pickups? It's rather impressive, actually.

item.title: A Strange Little Car Company You've Never Heard Of Has Basically The Same Exact Logo As Ferrari
item.description: I think Ferrari never bothered with them because it might have revealed a possibly uncomfortable truth about the origin of Ferrari's famous badge.

item.title: Cruise Lines Are Getting Desperate
item.description: Cruises were a dubious proposition before coronavirus, but now they're in far worse shape. Almost everywhere cruise lines look these days, the news isn't good.

item.title: Tesla Model Y Deep Dive Reveals A Much Better Engineered Car Than The Model 3
item.description: Automobile benchmarking company Munro & Associates is well known for having criticized the Tesla Model 3, with founder Sandy Munro calling the car's quality flaws similar to "a Kia in the '90s."

item.title: Ford's Quickly-Designed Powered Air-Purifying Respirators Are A Clever Re-Use Of F-150 And Hand Tool Parts
item.description: The push to produce more desperately-needed equipment like air purifiers and respirators is leading to some fascinating improvised quick engineering and design solutions.

item.title: The Failure Of This Self-Driving Truck Company Tells You All You Need To Know About Self-Driving Vehicles
item.description: Starsky Robotics was the first company to run an unmanned semi on a public highway. Now it's shutting down, and its co-founder has some unusually sensible and honest things to say about the industry.

item.title: I Ordered A Brand-New Chinese EV Online For $900
item.description: A $900 EV bought off the giant online shopping website Alibaba. That's right, a car bought online from the same website I bought some knockoff videogame stuff and a $7 smartwatch.

item.title: Here's Why Some LED Headlights Work And Others Just Blind Everybody
item.description: Here's how to figure out which ones to get.
item.kicker: THE GOOD, THE BAD AND THE LED

item.title: This Chart Will Tell You What Kind Of Space-Based Sci-Fi You're About To Watch Just By Looking At The Main Ship
item.description: There's almost always at least one signature spacecraft for any of these space-based sci-fi shows.

item.title: Check Out The Amazing Cars In This Random Hong Kong Parking Garage
item.description: I expected the garage to contain a bunch of modern vehicles parked nicely in their designated spots, but what we found was very, very different.

item.title: Here's How BMW Screwed Up Its Logo Redesign
item.description: As you may have heard, BMW updated its logo for the first time in over two decades, and, since it's a thing that happened in the world, some people are not happy about it.

item.title: Here Are The Most Common Illegal Things Car Dealerships Will Try To Do
item.description: Buying a car from a dealer isn't nearly as bad as it used to be. Unfortunately, there are still some stores that care more about profit than happy customers.
item.kicker: DON'T LET LIFE GIVE YOU A LEMON

item.title: This Is Why The Gas Pump Keeps Shutting Off On You All The Damn Time
item.description: An explanation of a very annoying phenomenon.

item.title: The Holy Grail Of GM Minivans Was Never Sold In The US And That's A Shame
item.description: 30 years later, there's no doubt that the quirky looking Pontiac Trans Sport is the coolest GM minivan ever. But what many don't realize is that the absolute Holy Grail version of the Trans Sport was offered only in Europe.

item.title: Japan's Biggest Used Car Auction, In Photos
item.description: Of the 4.4 million or so cars exported from Japan every year, around 1.4 million of those are used cars. Used JDM vehicles are the Japanese equivalent of a McDonald's; there's very few places in the world where you won't see one.

item.title: This Tesla Model X Has Driven Over 400,000 Miles. Here Are All The Parts That Had To Be Replaced
item.description: Here's a look at every part that had to be swapped for this electric crossover to reach 400,000 miles in this condition.

item.title: Modern Cars With Their 1980s Faces
item.description: These are just quick-and-dirty Photoshops, but they're enough to show me that, weirdly, I kind of like '80s faces on modern cars? There's something about some of these that sort of works, in an odd way.

item.title: The Bugatti Sedan Was Axed At The Last Minute For Being Too Ugly
item.description: Ten years ago, after Bugatti had successfully stunned the world with the world's-fastest car, it set its sights on making a sedan. It almost made it to production, and then everything went completely wrong with the design.

item.title: Tesla Remotely Removes Autopilot Features From Customer's Used Tesla Without Any Notice
item.description: One of the less-considered side effects of car features moving from hardware to software is that important features and abilities of a car can now be removed without any actual contact with a given car.

item.title: I Went To Hong Kong And Discovered The Weirdest Homemade Pickup Truck Ever
item.description: Last week, we spotted something different in front of a junkyard. It was a rare Nissan Pao that someone, for whatever reason, hacked up and turned into a pickup truck.

item.title: Idiot Allegedly Jokes He Has Coronavirus On Flight, Results In Emergency Landing And Arrest
item.description: If I were to ask you, "Hey, do you think it would be funny if I jokingly screamed I had coronavirus on a packed plane?" you'd probably respond, "Not at all, you f*cking moron."

item.title: I Went To Vietnam And Discovered A Custom Jeep Wagoneer Unlike Any Wagoneer You've Ever Seen
item.description: How the hell did this Toledo, Ohio-built Jeep — with its Kenosha, Wisconsin-built engine — make it all the way to Ho Chi Minh City?

item.title: This May Be The Only Amphibious Car Converted Into A Delivery Truck In The History Of Humankind
item.description: Our pals over at the Car Design Archives Facebook group posted a fascinating picture of an odd little truck. Why odd? Well, that truck started life as an amphibious WWII Volkswagen Schwimmwagen.

item.title: Harley-Davidson's Slow Decline Is Getting Hard To Watch
item.description: It's desperately trying to prop up U.S. sales, but the LiveWire hasn't been selling great and its core demo is aging out. Revenue numbers for 2019 released today were also a lot worse than expected.

item.title: The New Jeep Cherokee's Taillights Have An Idiotic Design
item.description: The problem isn't aesthetics; they're attractive taillights, with a nice swoopy LED taillight section and inset LED rectangular sections for the various functions, and the overall whole looks clean and modern and sleek. The look is fine. The problem is how the taillights work.

item.title: Badass Mercedes Unimog Trucks Set New World Altitude Record For Wheeled Vehicles
item.description: Wheeled vehicles can achieve near-airplane-like levels of altitude, if they can find ground high enough. And that's just what this truck did.

item.title: That Awful Email About An Employee's Old Car May Not Be Real But I Still Cannot Abide
item.description: "To be even more frank, it just looks bad."

item.title: Bridgestone Says Airless Tires Are Coming Soon To Bicycles And Big Rigs
item.description: Bridgestone's airless tires use a web of recycled thermoplastic instead of pneumatic pressure to keep a vehicle rolling. These new tires have been tested to hold upwards of 5000 pounds each, and provide a major benefit to truckers as they never lose pressure, and are completely puncture proof.

item.title: These Are The Greatest Engines Of The Last Decade
item.description: The 2010s were an interesting bunch of years. They saw the split between old-school methods of producing big power (fat displacement, superchargers) and modern ways of making driving efficient (cylinder deactivation, turbocharging). Some of the units listed here have been discontinued; others began their lives only recently and will hopefully continue to affect change into this new decade.

item.title: This 'One Owner' 1946 Farm Jeep Has A Fascinating And Mysterious History
item.description: I still own my first car. It's a 1992 Jeep Cherokee XJ that I bought in college in 2010. I get why somebody would want to own a car this long, but how? That's just one of many questions I have about this mysterious machine.

item.title: Let's Debunk Three Myths About Seemingly Illegal Things You Can Do While Driving
item.description: Almost every time driving barefoot comes up, though, some podiatric prude likes to mention that driving while barefoot is illegal. You know what, though? It's not.
item.kicker: NO SHIRT, NO SHOES, NO LAWS BROKEN

item.title: I Bought A 260,000-Mile 'Holy Grail' Jeep Grand Cherokee Sight Unseen From The Middle Of Nowhere. Getting It Home Nearly Broke Me
item.description: It was approaching midnight, and my friend was in shambles, his spirits having been crushed by 12 straight hours of extreme, high-intensity wrenching on the rare, manual transmission Jeep Grand Cherokee that I'd foolishly purchased sight unseen for $700. We were 1,300 miles from home, and I'd clearly made a grave mistake.

item.title: The Most Important Cars Of The Past 15 Years
item.description: In the 15 years Jalopnik's been online, we have watched all kinds of cars go into production, but let's be real, some are more important than others.

item.title: It's Time To Let Go Of Commuter Culture
item.description: Jonathan Leo loves his cars, but not commuting in them. He lives in San Diego and works for the Navy, so he takes the city's trolley to work as often as he can. Then, on the weekends, he unloads his 2012 Mercedes Benz C230 on some of California's best roads.

item.title: How A NASCAR Fan Got Sponsors To Buy Him A Tesla Model 3 With A Dale Earnhardt Tribute
item.description: The Intimidator inspired a generation of NASCAR fans, and people continue to pay tribute by throwing his livery on all sorts of stuff, including this Tesla Model 3.

item.title: These Are The Worst Cars Of The Decade
item.description: Let's do what has to be done, and call out the worst cars of the two thousand teens. Because someone has to.

item.title: Here's Why There Are Seven 'Missing' McLaren F1s
item.description: With an incredibly limited run of McLaren F1s ever produced, a mere 106, it's surprisingly easy to keep track of where the cars end up and the legends they accrue as time goes by. But somehow seven of those cars have gone missing.

item.title: Why A Cadillac XLR Brake Light Can Cost More Than A Used Corolla
item.description: Some bad designs are noticeable right away, their poorly-considered executions slap you in the face like a slice of wet ham. Others are more insidious, with problems lurking stealthily under the surface.

item.title: You Have No Idea How Insanely Complex Modern Headlights Can Be
item.description: I realized how out of touch I was regarding modern headlights this past week when I finally got a chance to drive Porsche's new EV, the Taycan.

item.title: Why A Judge Made Uber Create An Email Address
item.description: Uber even went so far as to argue in open court that creating an email address for drivers to opt out of an arbitration provision was too technically difficult for it to implement.

item.title: Here's Why The Porsche Taycan Turbo's EPA Range Is So Bad
item.description: The EPA rated the new 2020 Porsche Taycan Turbo's range at just 201 miles on a charge. That's worse than almost every other electric car on sale today, and far worse than the 300 miles Porsche teased a couple of years ago, so what made the EPA figure so low?

item.title: The 'Most Beautiful Car Ever Made' Looks Like A Tongue
item.description: The Jaguar E-Type was an incredible car when it debuted in 1961. It had disc brakes, independent suspension, rack-and-pinion steering, and monocoque construction that made it lightweight and resulted in great performance, especially for a car as inexpensive as it was. It was called the most beautiful car ever made by Enzo Ferrari, and it routinely tops automotive journalist's lists of best-looking cars. I disagree.

item.title: When The Lincoln Town Car Ruled New York
item.description: It wasn't a Rolls Royce, nor was it a 7 Series or even a Maybach. No, in my 12-year-old mind, the Lincoln Town Car signified power and mobility in 2000s New York City.

item.title: Uber Got Off Easy
item.description: At Tuesday's National Transportation Safety Board's hearing on the death of Elaine Herzberg, the woman struck and killed by Uber's self-driving test vehicle in March 2018, Uber hardly found itself in the firing line.

item.title: Here's How The Ford Mustang Mach-E's Unusual Doors Work
item.description: One of the 2021 Ford Mustang Mach-E's most interesting design features is its lack of traditional door handles.
item.kicker: WE DON'T NEED NO STINKIN' HANDLES

item.title: Zombie Miles And Napa Weekends: How A Week With Chauffeurs Showed The Major Flaw In Our Self-Driving Car Future
item.description: A few years ago, Mustapha Harb realized there was a problem in his field of research about how autonomous cars will change the way people travel.
